{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3337409,"name":"Rich Mansfield","username":"richpnats","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/r/59ef9b/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-03-19T18:46:58.208Z","cooked":"

I have a rev through bore encoder, well actually like 8 of them. I am trying to use the basic wpilib example for dutycycle encoder here:
allwpilib/wpilibjExamples/src/main/java/edu/wpi/first/wpilibj/examples/dutycycleencoder/Robot.java at main · wpilibsuite/allwpilib · GitHub

But I get no response from any of the encoders. I additionally tried to set up the encoder as quad encoder and no data on the smart dashboard either.
I am using the wire which is Red, White and Black on the DIO port on the rio.
Attached are some pictures
IMG_3078.pdf (20.1 MB)
IMG_3077.pdf (20.6 MB)
IMG_3076.pdf (20.4 MB)

What are you planning on using the sensors for?

have you tried other DIO ports, in case that particular one is dead? the Rev site also warns that there is a switch on the encoder that must be switched to “A”: Application Information | Through Bore Encoder

Wiring seems OK. Dead port or bad encoder are unlikely, but possible. Are you using the example code right now? That uses DIO 0, which is where the photo shows you being plugged in… This is a good plan – it keeps things really simple as far as the code. The little switch seems worth checking, as there’s not much left.

There’s been a couple of times that a student (or mentor) put the encoder cable into the port a little crooked. A pin got bent and we got no reading. Might double check that.

If you’ve got a spark max and an encoder board you can plug it in and use the REV hardware client to check encoder values.

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":7,"updated_at":"2024-03-19T20:42:53.455Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":55,"readers_count":54,"score":21.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":459290,"topic_slug":"rev-through-bore-absolute-encoder-not-working","display_username":"Tom","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":14980,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"4276 nice mentor"},"post_url":"/t/rev-through-bore-absolute-encoder-not-working/459290/5","custom_user_title":"4276 nice mentor","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3337585,"name":"Domtech","username":"Domtech","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/domtech/{size}/138487_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-19T20:50:09.796Z","cooked":"
Zook:

If you’ve got a spark max and an encoder board you can plug it in and use the REV hardware client to check encoder values.

Or set a SparkMax to brushed mode and you can just plug it into the encoder port. Just make sure to set it back before using with a brushless motor.
